meanings.definition: The fruit of the hawthorn tree.
meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe haw from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The haw looked red and juicy on the branch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel nibbled on the haw with delight.
meanings.sent4: The haw resembled a tiny apple, hanging in clusters.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the haw filled the air in the orchard.

meanings.sent1: The donkey would haw loudly in the barn.
meanings.sent2: He would often haw when he laughed heartily.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made everyone haw with laughter.
meanings.sent4: His voice seemed to haw with excitement as he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The old car engine would haw before starting up.

meanings.definition: To hesitate or falter in speech.
meanings.sent1: She would haw before answering difficult questions.
meanings.sent2: The nervous speaker began to haw during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: His mind would haw as he tried to recall the answer.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech started to haw as he lost his train of thought.
meanings.sent5: The student's voice began to haw as she spoke in front of the class.
